channel.title: Living Sports Analytics
channel.description: Latest sports analytics research papers, blog posts, and grey literature — curated and classified by AI

item.title: Who is More Injury‐Prone? Prediction and Assessment of Injury Risk
item.description: Develops machine learning model using movement efficiency, IoT acceleration data, functional roles, and exposure metrics to predict injury risk in college football players, enabling individualized rather than one-size-fits-all injury prevention interventions.

item.title: Predicting outcome of matches using pressure index: evidence from Twenty20 cricket
item.description: Discriminant analysis applied to pressure index predicts Twenty20 cricket match outcomes with 90.7% accuracy on training data and 78.4% on holdout validation.
item.source: Communications in Statistics - Simulation and Computation

item.title: A ski injury risk assessment model for ski resorts
item.description: A spatial-temporal ski injury risk assessment model using ski lift transportation data identifies critical regions and injury patterns across ski resort terrain to enable targeted prevention strategies.

item.title: The Relationship Between the National Football League Scouting Combine and Game Performance Over a 5-Year Period
item.description: 5-year analysis of 1,537 NFL players shows Scouting Combine physical tests explain only 2.6% of first-year game performance variance with weak correlations (r<0.3), suggesting Combine measures have minimal predictive validity for player selection.
item.source: The Journal of Strength and Conditioning Research

item.title: Data‐driven exploratory approach on player valuation in football transfer market
item.description: Regression, feature selection, and cluster analysis classify football players into four performance-fee groups, revealing position-dependent skill impacts on valuation in the transfer market.
item.source: Concurrency and Computation Practice and Experience

item.title: Measurement Space Partitioning for Estimation and Prediction
item.description: Proposes measurement space partitioning method using batted-ball trajectory data to improve prediction accuracy of batter talent, outperforming traditional linear regression and standard machine learning approaches with contextual adjustments.

item.title: The effects of travel on performance: a 13-year analysis of the National Rugby League (NRL) competition
item.description: Analysis of 2,352 NRL matches (2007-2019) shows that travel reduces winning probability by 2.7% per 1,000 km, with effects diminishing over time, though modern conditions appear to mitigate travel disadvantage.

item.title: Finding Your Feet: A Gaussian Process Model for Estimating the Abilities of Batsmen in Test Cricket
item.description: A Bayesian Gaussian process model quantifies and predicts career-long fluctuations in cricket batsmen's abilities, outperforming traditional batting averages and ICC ratings.
item.source: Journal of the Royal Statistical Society Series C (Applied Statistics)

item.title: The Winning Probability of a Game and the Importance of Points in Tennis Matches
item.description: A discrete-time Markov chain analysis of ATP tour matches (2011-2015) demonstrates that server point-winning probabilities vary significantly across game states and depend on previous point outcomes.
item.source: Research Quarterly for Exercise and Sport

item.title: Pursuing sources of heterogeneity in modeling clustered population
item.description: A regularized finite mixture effects regression identifies heterogeneous relationships between MLB player performance metrics, contract status, and salary levels across player clusters.

item.title: Detecting drivers of basketball successful games: an exploratory study with machine learning algorithms
item.description: CART and Random Forest models identify defensive performance as the key driver of Golden State Warriors' NBA victories using box scores and Dean's four factors.

item.title: Are “Tech-Savvy” Owners Better for Business? Evidence From Major League Baseball
item.description: MLB analysis over 14 years shows owners with business intelligence expertise increase operating margins modestly through labor cost efficiency rather than revenue generation, with effects moderated by tenure.

item.title: Examining the evolution and classification of player position using performance indicators in the National Rugby League during the 2015–2019 seasons
item.description: Cluster analysis and discriminant analysis of National Rugby League performance data (2015-2019) identified six distinct positional groups and revealed significant seasonal changes in positional performance demands.
item.source: Journal of science and medicine in sport

item.title: Analysis of styles of play according to season and end of season rank in the National Rugby League
item.description: Principal component analysis identified nine distinct styles of play in the National Rugby League (2015-2019), with attacking, defensive, and contested dimensions differing by season and final ladder position.
item.source: Journal of science and medicine in sport

item.title: Simulation-based decision making in the NFL using NFLSimulatoR
item.description: NFLSimulatoR R package enables simulation-based evaluation of NFL in-game strategies like fourth-down decisions, demonstrating teams should pass more frequently than current standard practice.

item.title: A regularized hidden Markov model for analyzing the ‘hot shoe’ in football
item.description: Penalized hidden Markov models with elastic net regularization detected a 'hot shoe' effect in soccer penalty takers, identifying latent performance states affecting success probability.

item.title: Dealing With Statistical Significance in Big Data: The Social Media Value of Game Outcomes in Professional Football
item.description: Game outcomes significantly affect professional football clubs' social media follower growth across Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, with victories yielding the highest follower increases.

item.title: Forecasting binary outcomes in soccer
item.description: Score-driven models forecasted binary soccer outcomes (red cards, Under/Over, Goal/No Goal) in English Premier League and Italian Serie A for profitable betting strategies.

item.title: Change the rules, change the game? Offensive tactics in elite men’s water polo from London to Tokyo
item.description: Water polo offensive tactics shifted significantly between 2012 and 2020 Olympics, with increased perimeter shooting and decreased counterattacks; exclusions and counterattack efficiency were key predictors of match outcomes.
item.source: International Journal of Performance Analysis in Sport

item.title: Markov Switching Modelling of Shooting Performance Variability and Teammate Interactions in Basketball
item.description: Markov switching models identified positive and negative player interactions affecting team shooting performance, providing a network-based tool for coaching lineup decisions.
item.source: Journal of the Royal Statistical Society Series C (Applied Statistics)

item.title: Continuous-time state-space modelling of the hot hand in basketball
item.description: Continuous-time state-space modeling of 110,513 NBA free throws confirmed the hot hand effect exists but with small magnitude, elevating success probabilities by only a few percentage points.

item.title: Differentiating movement styles in professional tennis: A machine learning and hierarchical clustering approach
item.description: Hierarchical clustering of 150,000 direction changes from 62 male and 77 female professional tennis players identifies five distinct COD styles (Cutters, Gear Changers, Lateral Changers, Balanced Changers, Passive Changers) for athlete profiling.

item.title: Return to performance following severe ankle, knee, and hip injuries in National Basketball Association players
item.description: NBA players with severe lower extremity injuries showed limited return to performance, with fewer than 45% playing 2 years post-injury and fewer than 42% reaching preinjury performance levels.

item.title: The relationship between match performance indicators and outcome in Australian Football
item.description: Decision tree and GLM models predict Australian Football match outcomes with up to 95.1% accuracy, identifying turnovers forced and inside 50s per shot as most predictive indicators.
item.source: Journal of science and medicine in sport

item.title: Constructing Spaces and Times for Tactical Analysis in Football
item.description: A framework for analyzing football tracking data constructs dynamic spatial-temporal reference systems to detect and visualize general patterns of coordinated team movement in different game situations.
item.source: IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics

item.title: The effect of team formation on defensive performance in Australian football
item.description: Logistic regression and decision tree analysis of Australian Football GPS and event data show team formation wider than long associated with positive turnover outcomes, though most formation characteristics lack defensive impact.
item.source: Journal of science and medicine in sport

item.title: Reimagining the role of technology in sport officiating: how artificial intelligence (AI) supports the design and delivery of ecologically dynamic development processes
item.description: Conceptual framework proposes using AI/machine learning technologies to support ecologically dynamic development of sport officials' decision-making and judgment across multiple sports contexts.

item.title: Bayesian hierarchical modelling of basketball tracking data - a case study of spatial entropy and spatial effectiveness
item.description: A Bayesian hierarchical model was applied to basketball tracking data to analyze spatial autocorrelation and found a generally positive association between ball movement entropy and spatial effectiveness, with strength varying by spatial scale.

item.title: Exploring the components of brand equity amid declining ticket sales in Major League Baseball
item.description: A PLS-SEM analysis of MLB data found that attendance and local television partially/fully mediate the relationship between marketing assets and financial performance, with Twitter followers moderating several relationships in the brand equity model.

item.title: Technological advances in elite marathon performance
item.description: Analysis of World Marathon Major races shows elite runners wearing advanced Nike shoes achieved 2.0-2.6% faster marathon times compared to other footwear.

item.title: Rating Player Actions in Soccer
item.description: A graph recurrent neural network trained on soccer tracking data was used to predict player trajectories and ball possession outcomes, enabling data-driven rating of individual player actions and their contribution to team success.
item.source: Frontiers in Sports and Active Living

item.title: Where to go: Computational and visual what-if analyses in soccer
item.description: An automated system using computer vision was developed to detect faulty region-based player movements in professional soccer matches and suggest improved alternatives, validated by expert coaches with 83% agreement on recommendations.

item.title: Toward Automatically Labeling Situations in Soccer
item.description: Variational autoencoders learn feature representations from unlabeled soccer video to detect corner kicks, crosses, and counterattacks with >90% AUC using minimal labeled training data.
item.source: Frontiers in Sports and Active Living

item.title: Scheduling the Valley Baseball League
item.description: Mathematical programming was used to generate an optimized schedule for the Valley Baseball League that significantly outperformed manually produced schedules while satisfying league mandates and team-specific constraints.

item.title: Clustering algorithms to increase fairness in collegiate wrestling
item.description: Custom clustering algorithms based on genetic algorithms were developed to optimally assign NCAA Division III wrestling schools to regions, improving fairness for individual wrestlers competing for national tournament qualification.
item.source: Journal of Quantitative Analysis in Sports

item.title: Can Social Media Predict Soccer Clubs’ Stock Prices? The Case of Turkish Teams and Twitter
item.description: Twitter sentiment analysis predicts stock prices of Turkish soccer clubs better than traditional betting odds as indicator of pre-match investor expectations.

item.title: Simulating Defensive Trajectories in American Football for Predicting League Average Defensive Movements
item.description: Multi-agent imitation learning with deep neural networks simulates NFL defensive player trajectories from tracking data, achieving 81% accuracy in pass completion probability prediction for evaluating defensive performance.
item.source: Frontiers in Sports and Active Living

item.title: In-game win probability models for Canadian football
item.description: Logistic regression and gradient boosting models predict in-game win probability for Canadian Football League using play-by-play data and wagering information to support coaching decisions.

item.title: Identifying and analysing game styles and factors influencing a team’s strategy in field hockey
item.description: K-means clustering and decision trees identify game styles in international field hockey (74 female, 57 male matches) showing that opponent strategy is more influential than contextual factors in predicting team tactics.

item.title: Data Reduction Approaches to Athlete Monitoring in Professional Australian Football
item.description: Principal component analysis of GPS and wellness data from Australian Football League players reduces monitoring data overload by identifying key components: external load, perceived wellness, and chronic speed exposure.
item.source: International Journal of Sports Physiology and Performance

item.title: Extraordinary circumstances: Covid-19 – Italian Serie A scenario
item.description: Hierarchical cluster analysis methodology proposes reducing remaining Serie A matches from 124 to 14 to conclude interrupted season, validated across 10 past seasons.
item.source: Proceedings of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers Part P Journal of Sports Engineering and Technology

item.title: A cluster analysis of basketball players for each of the five traditionally defined positions
item.description: Hierarchical clustering of 15 NBA seasons identifies 4-6 position-specific player style clusters per position, using adjusted plus-minus and win differential to guide roster construction.
item.source: Proceedings of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers Part P Journal of Sports Engineering and Technology

item.title: Business Intelligence: How Sport Scientists Can Support Organization Decision Making in Professional Sport
item.description: Commentary proposing a business intelligence framework for sport scientists in professional organizations, integrating data collection, statistical analysis, and decision-support models to enhance organizational performance across multiple sports domains.
item.source: International Journal of Sports Physiology and Performance

item.title: Visual recognition and performance prediction of athletes based on target tracking EIA algorithm
item.description: Development of multi-feature adaptive fusion algorithm combining EIA and compressed sensing for improved athlete target tracking and visual feature recognition in sports.

item.title: A Dimension Reduction Approach to Player Rankings in European Football
item.description: Dimension reduction framework for evaluating left and right back performance across global football competitions shows that highly-ranked players experience increased transfer values and move to suitable teams.

item.title: Individual role classification for players defending corners in football (soccer)
item.description: CNN-LSTM model achieves 89.3% accuracy classifying seven defensive player roles during soccer corners using positional tracking data, enabling fact-based tactical decision-making.
item.source: Journal of Quantitative Analysis in Sports

item.title: Major league baseball’sMoneyballat age 15: a re-appraisal
item.description: Re-appraisal of Moneyball's central premise using 45 seasons of MLB data validates the importance of on-base percentage for team success, though payroll efficiency gains following the book's publication appear to have dissipated over time.

item.title: High-Performance Practice Processes
item.description: Mathematical modeling of optimal practice strategies for both motor and cognitive skill acquisition shows that performance is maximized through U-shaped effort profiles with alternating cycles of stress and rest, consistent across multiple sports.

item.title: A Variance Gamma model for Rugby Union matches
item.description: A Variance Gamma statistical model for Rugby Union matches provides analytical solutions for predicting match outcomes, total scores, and bonus points using bookmakers' data and historical results.
item.source: Journal of Quantitative Analysis in Sports

item.title: How the COVID-19 Pandemic has Changed the Game of Soccer
item.description: Analysis of Bundesliga matches during COVID-19 lockdown found that empty stadiums reduced home advantage by 44.2% in away wins, decreased referee bias in yellow card distribution, and increased player running intensity and tactical adaptations.
